uniqueRequirements: Must successfully answer 15 of the 18 questions to pass (83%)
Permit is valid for one year from the date of issue
Must complete 65 hours of supervised practice (including 10 at night and 5 in bad weather) before road test
Junior license holders cannot drive between 11 PM and 5 AM
Mandatory physical examination (Form DL-180) must be completed by a doctor/nurse practitioner before applying

questions.questionText: A driver with a Junior Learner's Permit may not drive between the hours of ___ and ___ unless accompanied by a parent, guardian, or spouse over 18.
questions.explanation: Holders of a Junior Learner's Permit or Junior Driver's License are restricted from driving between 11 PM and 5 AM unless for work or charitable service with proper documentation.

questions.questionText: Pennsylvania law requires you to turn on your headlights:

answers.text: Only when it is completely dark
Whenever your windshield wipers are in continuous or intermittent use
When driving in a residential area

questions.explanation: You must turn on your headlights anytime your vehicle's windshield wipers are in use due to rain, snow, sleet, or mist.

questions.questionText: When driving through an active work zone, you must:

answers.text: Honk your horn to alert workers

questions.explanation: In Pennsylvania, you must turn on your headlights while driving through an active work zone, regardless of the time of day.

questions.questionText: Under Pennsylvania's 'Move Over' law, if you approach a stationary emergency vehicle or tow truck with flashing lights, you must:

answers.text: Move into a lane not adjacent to the emergency vehicle if possible, or slow down significantly
Speed up to clear the area quickly
Maintain your speed and stay in your lane

questions.explanation: Drivers must move over to a lane furthest from the emergency vehicle. If unable to move over safely, they must slow down to a speed no more than 20 mph below the posted limit.

questions.questionText: For the first 6 months of holding a Junior Driver's License, you may not carry more than ___ passenger(s) under age 18 who is not an immediate family member.
questions.explanation: During the first 6 months of a junior license, you are limited to 1 passenger under 18 who is not immediate family, unless a parent/guardian is in the vehicle.

questions.questionText: When following another vehicle, the Pennsylvania Driver's Manual recommends using the:
questions.explanation: Pennsylvania recommends a 4-second following distance to allow enough time to react to hazards.

questions.questionText: Hydroplaning can start at speeds as low as:
questions.explanation: Hydroplaning (tires riding on a film of water) can occur at speeds as low as 35 mph. Slow down in wet conditions.

questions.questionText: When you hear a siren or see a vehicle approaching with flashing red lights, you must:

answers.text: Speed up and get out of the way
Drive to the right-hand curb or edge of the road and stop

questions.explanation: You must yield the right-of-way to emergency vehicles by pulling over to the right edge of the road and stopping.

questions.questionText: If you drift off the pavement onto the shoulder, you should:

answers.text: Ease off the gas, slow down, and steer back onto the road gradually
Jerk the wheel immediately to get back on the road

questions.explanation: Do not brake suddenly or steer sharply. Ease off the gas, grip the wheel tightly, and steer back onto the road when safe.

questions.questionText: It is illegal to park within ___ feet of a fire hydrant.
questions.explanation: You may not park within 15 feet of a fire hydrant in Pennsylvania.

questions.questionText: When parking downhill with a curb, turn your steering wheel:
questions.explanation: Turn your wheels to the right (towards the curb) when parking downhill so the vehicle will roll into the curb if the brakes fail.

questions.questionText: At a four-way stop, if two vehicles arrive at the same time:

answers.text: The vehicle on the left has the right-of-way
The vehicle on the right has the right-of-way
The driver who signals first goes

questions.explanation: At a 4-way stop, the driver on the left must yield to the driver on the right if they arrive simultaneously.

questions.questionText: Who must yield when a driver is turning left?

answers.text: The driver turning left must yield to oncoming traffic
Pedestrians must yield to the car

questions.explanation: Drivers turning left must yield the right-of-way to oncoming vehicles and pedestrians.

questions.questionText: A yellow pennant-shaped sign on the left side of the road means:
questions.explanation: The pennant (sideways triangle) shape is used exclusively to mark the beginning of a No Passing Zone.

questions.questionText: An orange triangle with a red border on the back of a vehicle indicates:
questions.explanation: The slow-moving vehicle emblem is a fluorescent orange triangle with a red border, indicating the vehicle travels at 25 mph or less.

questions.questionText: A red and white inverted triangle sign means:
questions.explanation: The inverted (downward-pointing) triangle is the standard shape for a Yield sign.

questions.questionText: A diamond-shaped sign with black arrows in a circular pattern means:
questions.explanation: This sign warns of a circular intersection or roundabout ahead.

questions.questionText: A rectangular white sign with black lettering usually indicates:
questions.explanation: Rectangular white signs are regulatory signs that inform you of traffic laws (e.g., Speed Limit, No Turn on Red).

questions.questionText: If you are under 21 years old, you are considered to be driving under the influence (DUI) if your Blood Alcohol Concentration (BAC) is ___ or higher.
questions.explanation: Pennsylvania is a Zero Tolerance state. For drivers under 21, the legal limit is 0.02%.

questions.questionText: When stopping for a school bus with flashing red lights, you must stop at least ___ feet away from the bus.
questions.explanation: You must stop at least 10 feet away from a school bus with flashing red lights and extended stop arm.

questions.questionText: You must signal your turn at least ___ feet before turning if you are driving less than 35 mph.
questions.explanation: If driving under 35 mph, signal at least 100 feet before the turn. If driving 35 mph or more, signal at least 300 feet.

questions.questionText: If you are driving 35 mph or more, you must signal your turn at least ___ feet before turning.
questions.explanation: For speeds of 35 mph or higher, Pennsylvania law requires signaling at least 300 feet in advance.

questions.questionText: To avoid a collision with a deer, you should:

answers.text: Brake firmly and hold the wheel straight

questions.explanation: Do not swerve, as this may cause you to lose control or hit another vehicle. Brake firmly and stay in your lane.

questions.questionText: A yellow diamond-shaped sign with a truck going down a slope means:
questions.explanation: This sign warns of a steep downgrade/hill ahead where heavy vehicles may need to use lower gears.

questions.questionText: A sign with a black crossbuck ('X') and the letters 'RR' indicates:

answers.text: Railroad crossing at the location of the sign

questions.explanation: The Crossbuck sign is placed at the railroad crossing itself. The round yellow 'RR' sign is the advanced warning.

questions.questionText: Unless otherwise posted, the maximum speed limit in a residential area is:
questions.explanation: The default speed limit in residential districts is 25 mph unless posted otherwise.

questions.questionText: Under the 'Implied Consent' law, by driving in Pennsylvania, you agree to:

answers.text: Submit to a chemical test for alcohol or drugs if suspected of DUI

questions.explanation: Implied Consent means you have agreed to take a breath, blood, or urine test if arrested for DUI. Refusal results in automatic license suspension.

questions.questionText: The top major cause of crashes in work zones is:
questions.explanation: Speeding is the number one cause of crashes in work zones.

questions.questionText: You cannot park within ___ feet of a crosswalk at an intersection.
questions.explanation: Parking is prohibited within 20 feet of a crosswalk at an intersection.

questions.questionText: When entering a highway from an entrance ramp, you should:

answers.text: Stop at the end of the ramp and wait for a gap
Drive slowly to let other drivers see you
Accelerate to the speed of traffic and merge safely
Flash your lights to ask for permission

questions.explanation: Use the acceleration lane to match the speed of highway traffic before merging.

questions.questionText: If your gas pedal sticks, you should:

answers.text: Shift to Neutral and steer to a safe stop

questions.explanation: Shift to Neutral to disconnect the engine from the wheels, then guide the car to the side of the road.

questions.questionText: A five-sided (pentagon) sign indicating a School Zone is:
questions.explanation: School zone signs are pentagon-shaped and colored yellow or fluorescent yellow-green.

questions.questionText: You are required to use your turn signals at least ___ before changing lanes on the highway.
questions.explanation: While turning requires 300 feet at highway speeds, general lane changes should be signaled well in advance. The specific statutory requirement for speeds >35mph is 300 feet. Let's stick to the 300 feet rule for consistency.

questions.questionText: What is the penalty for a first-time conviction of driving without insurance in PA?
questions.explanation: Driving without insurance results in a $300 fine and a 3-month suspension of your license and vehicle registration.

questions.questionText: Pedestrians in a crosswalk:

answers.text: Have the right-of-way at all times
Only have the right-of-way when the light is green

questions.explanation: Drivers must yield to pedestrians in a crosswalk, whether marked or unmarked.

questions.questionText: A sign with a curved arrow and a red circle with a slash means:

answers.text: No U-turn (or No Turn in direction shown)

questions.explanation: A red circle with a slash over a symbol means that action is prohibited.

questions.questionText: The most effective thing you can do to reduce your risk of injury in a crash is:
questions.explanation: Wearing a seat belt is the single most effective way to prevent death or injury in a crash.

questions.questionText: It is illegal to park within ___ feet of a stop sign.
questions.explanation: Parking is prohibited within 30 feet of any flashing signal, stop sign, or traffic control signal.

questions.questionText: Fines in a construction zone are ___ if workers are present.
questions.explanation: Fines for moving violations in active work zones are doubled.

questions.questionText: Green highway guide signs indicate:
questions.explanation: Green signs provide guidance information, such as destinations, directions, and distances.

questions.questionText: It is illegal to pass another vehicle:

answers.text: Within 100 feet of a railroad crossing or intersection
When there is a broken yellow line
When the vehicle ahead is going below the speed limit

questions.explanation: Passing is prohibited within 100 feet of an intersection, railroad crossing, bridge, viaduct, or tunnel.

questions.questionText: When checking your blind spots before changing lanes, you should:

answers.text: Rely only on your side mirrors
Turn your head to look over your shoulder

questions.explanation: You must turn your head to look over your shoulder to check the area your mirrors cannot see.

questions.questionText: In PA, who must wear a seat belt?

answers.text: The driver and all passengers under age 18
The driver and front seat passengers, plus anyone under 18 in the back
Only passengers in the front seat

questions.explanation: PA law requires the driver and front seat passengers to wear seat belts. Additionally, all passengers under age 18 must be buckled regardless of seating position.

questions.questionText: A sign with two arrows pointing in opposite directions (up and down) means:
questions.explanation: This warning sign indicates that you are leaving a one-way street and entering a two-way street.

questions.questionText: When approaching a steady yellow traffic light, you should:

answers.text: Speed up to beat the red light
Stop if it is safe to do so
Keep going at the same speed
Treat it as a stop sign

questions.explanation: A steady yellow light means the signal is changing to red. Stop if you can do so safely; otherwise, proceed with caution.

questions.questionText: Parking is prohibited within ___ feet of a railroad crossing.
questions.explanation: You may not park within 50 feet of the nearest rail of a railroad crossing.

questions.questionText: If you miss your exit on an expressway, you should:

answers.text: Make a U-turn in the median
Pull onto the shoulder and wait

questions.explanation: Never back up on a highway. Go to the next exit and work your way back.

questions.questionText: A chevron sign (arrow pointing to the right or left) indicates:

answers.text: Sharp curve in the direction of the arrow

questions.explanation: Chevrons mark the edge of the road on sharp curves.

questions.questionText: If you accumulate ___ or more points on your driving record, PennDOT will take corrective action.
questions.explanation: PennDOT begins corrective action (exams, hearings) when a driver reaches 6 points.

questions.questionText: In a school zone, when the yellow lights are flashing, the speed limit is:
questions.explanation: The speed limit in an active school zone with flashing lights is 15 mph.

questions.questionText: The only thing that will sober you up after drinking is:
questions.explanation: Only time allows the body to process and remove alcohol. Coffee and showers do not lower BAC.

questions.questionText: Blue signs usually indicate:
questions.explanation: Blue signs provide information about motorist services like gas, food, and hospitals.

questions.questionText: When exiting a driveway or alley, you must:

answers.text: Stop and yield to pedestrians and traffic

questions.explanation: You must stop before the sidewalk and yield to pedestrians and traffic when emerging from an alley or driveway.

questions.questionText: A sign with a truck and a red circle/slash means:
questions.explanation: The red circle with a slash indicates 'No Trucks'.

questions.questionText: You are approaching a blind pedestrian carrying a white cane. You must:

answers.text: Honk to let them know you are there

questions.explanation: Drivers must always yield to blind pedestrians using a white cane or guide dog.

questions.questionText: When night driving, you should dim your high beams when an oncoming vehicle is within:
questions.explanation: You must switch to low beams within 500 feet of an oncoming vehicle.

questions.questionText: When following another vehicle at night, dim your high beams within:
questions.explanation: Switch to low beams when following a vehicle within 300 feet.

questions.questionText: Brown signs indicate:
questions.explanation: Brown signs point to parks, recreation areas, museums, and historical sites.

questions.questionText: It is illegal to use a cell phone for texting while driving:

answers.text: Unless stopped at a red light

questions.explanation: Texting while driving is banned for all drivers in Pennsylvania.

questions.questionText: You cannot park within ___ feet of a driveway entrance to a fire station.

answers.text: 75 feet (on the opposite side of the street)

questions.explanation: You cannot park within 20 feet of a fire station driveway, or 75 feet on the opposite side of the street if posted.

questions.questionText: Exceeding the speed limit in an active work zone by 11 mph or more results in a mandatory ___ suspension.
questions.explanation: Excessive speeding in a work zone (11+ mph over) results in a 15-day license suspension.

questions.questionText: A sign with a bicycle symbol indicates:
questions.explanation: This sign warns that bicyclists may be on the road or crossing.

questions.questionText: You may turn right on red:

answers.text: Unless a sign prohibits it, after stopping and yielding

questions.explanation: Right on red is permitted after a full stop, unless a 'No Turn on Red' sign is posted.

questions.questionText: In heavy fog, use your:
questions.explanation: Use low beams in fog. High beams reflect off the moisture and cause glare.

questions.questionText: When entering a roundabout:

answers.text: You have the right of way
Yield to traffic already in the roundabout

questions.explanation: Drivers entering a roundabout must yield to traffic already circulating.

questions.questionText: A sign with a 'T' shape intersection means:

answers.text: Road ends, be prepared to turn left or right

questions.explanation: The T-intersection sign warns that the road ends ahead and you must turn.

questions.questionText: The blind spots for large trucks are called:
questions.explanation: No-Zones are the large blind spots around trucks where cars disappear from the driver's view.

questions.questionText: A steady red arrow means:
questions.explanation: A steady red arrow means you must stop and may not turn in the direction of the arrow.

questions.questionText: An octagon shaped sign is always a:
questions.explanation: The octagon (8-sided) shape is exclusively reserved for Stop signs.

questions.questionText: If you experience brake failure, you should:
questions.explanation: Pump brakes, shift down, and use the parking brake to stop a vehicle with failed service brakes.

questions.questionText: Failure to stop for a school bus with flashing red lights carries a penalty of:
questions.explanation: Passing a school bus results in a 60-day suspension, 5 points, and a $250 fine.

questions.questionText: A yellow sign with a deer symbol means:
questions.explanation: This sign warns drivers that deer are likely to cross the road in this area.

questions.questionText: When turning, the rear wheels follow a ___ path than the front wheels.
questions.explanation: Rear wheels off-track and follow a shorter path (cut the corner) compared to front wheels.

questions.questionText: On a wet road, you should reduce your speed by about:
questions.explanation: PA manual suggests slowing down by 10 mph on wet roads and even more on snow.

questions.questionText: When two vehicles meet on a steep mountain road where neither can pass, which vehicle has the right-of-way?
questions.explanation: The vehicle facing downhill must yield and back up, as the uphill vehicle has less control when backing.

questions.questionText: Double parking (parking parallel to a vehicle already at the curb) is:
questions.explanation: Double parking is illegal in Pennsylvania.

questions.questionText: A vertical rectangular sign is typically:
questions.explanation: Vertical rectangles are used for regulatory signs like Speed Limit.

questions.questionText: A broken yellow centerline means:
questions.explanation: Broken yellow lines separate traffic moving in opposite directions and indicate passing is allowed.

questions.questionText: If you see a funeral procession, you should:

answers.text: Cut through it if there is a gap
Yield the right-of-way until it passes

questions.explanation: Drivers must yield to funeral processions and not cut in between vehicles.

questions.questionText: Homicide by vehicle while DUI results in a minimum ___ prison term.
questions.explanation: Homicide by vehicle while DUI carries a 3-year mandatory minimum prison sentence.

questions.questionText: A sign showing a car with 'squiggly' lines behind the tires means:
questions.explanation: This sign warns that the road surface is slippery when wet.

questions.questionText: You are approaching an intersection with a flashing yellow light. You should:

answers.text: Slow down and proceed with caution

questions.explanation: A flashing yellow light means caution. Slow down and look carefully.

questions.questionText: To prevent highway hypnosis, you should:

answers.text: Keep your eyes moving and take breaks

questions.explanation: Keep eyes moving, check mirrors, and stop every 2 hours to avoid fatigue.

questions.questionText: A sign with a '+ ' symbol indicates:
questions.explanation: The cross symbol warns of a 4-way intersection ahead.

questions.questionText: When entering a public road from a private driveway:

answers.text: You have the right of way
Yield to all vehicles and pedestrians
Yield only to vehicles from the left

questions.explanation: Vehicles entering from a driveway must yield to all traffic and pedestrians on the main road.

questions.questionText: A white curb usually indicates:
questions.explanation: White curbs typically indicate a passenger loading/unloading zone.

questions.questionText: Speeding 6 to 10 mph over the limit results in ___ points.
questions.explanation: Speeding 6-10 mph over the limit is a 2-point violation in PA.

questions.questionText: You should check your mirrors:
questions.explanation: Check mirrors every 3 to 5 seconds to stay aware of surroundings.

questions.questionText: A sign with a clearance height (e.g., 12' 6") warns of:
questions.explanation: This sign warns of low clearance structures ahead.

questions.questionText: When passing a bicyclist, you must allow at least ___ of clearance.
questions.explanation: PA law requires a minimum of 4 feet of clearance when passing a bicycle.

questions.questionText: A yellow sign with a black arrow curving right means:
questions.explanation: This warning sign indicates a curve to the right is approaching.

questions.questionText: If you have a tire blowout:

answers.text: Hold the steering wheel firmly and ease off the gas

questions.explanation: Do not brake. Grip the wheel, ease off the gas, and stabilize the vehicle before pulling over.

questions.questionText: A solid white line between lanes means:
questions.explanation: Solid white lines indicate lane changes are discouraged or prohibited (e.g., tunnels, bridges).

questions.questionText: When exiting a parking spot:
questions.explanation: You must yield to all moving traffic when pulling out of a parking spot.

questions.questionText: If you fail to stop for a school bus with flashing red lights, how many points are added to your record?
questions.explanation: Violating the school bus stopping law results in 5 points on your driving record.

questions.questionText: A sign with a 'No Left Turn' symbol means:
questions.explanation: The red circle with a slash and a left arrow means left turns are prohibited.

questions.questionText: The law requires that you park:

answers.text: No more than 12 inches from the curb
No more than 6 inches from the curb
At least 2 feet from the curb

questions.explanation: You must park no more than 12 inches from the curb.

questions.questionText: If you change your address, you must notify PennDOT within:
questions.explanation: You must notify PennDOT of an address change within 15 days.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'Keep Right' and an arrow around a median:

answers.text: Stay to the right of the obstruction

questions.explanation: This regulatory sign tells you to keep to the right of a traffic island or divider.

questions.questionText: When passing a large truck, you should:

answers.text: Pass quickly and don't linger in the blind spot

questions.explanation: Pass trucks quickly to minimize time in their 'No-Zones' (blind spots).

questions.questionText: A sign with a 'Merge' arrow means:
questions.explanation: This warning sign indicates traffic from another road is merging into your lane.

questions.questionText: Speeding 31 mph or more over the limit results in:
questions.explanation: Excessive speeding (31+ mph over) triggers a departmental hearing, 5 points, and mandatory 15-day suspension.

questions.questionText: The 'Steer Clear' law requires you to:
questions.explanation: The Steer Clear law (now 'Move Over') requires moving over or slowing down for stopped emergency/service vehicles.

questions.questionText: If you see a blind pedestrian, you should:

answers.text: Stop immediately and let them pass

questions.explanation: Always yield to blind pedestrians; do not honk as it may confuse them.

questions.questionText: You cannot park within ___ feet of the driveway entrance to a fire station on the opposite side of the street (if posted).
questions.explanation: If posted, you cannot park within 75 feet of a fire station entrance on the opposite side of the street.

questions.questionText: A sign showing a person using a shovel means:
questions.explanation: This symbol warns of road workers or maintenance ahead.

questions.questionText: When a traffic light turns green, you should:

answers.text: Check the intersection for traffic and pedestrians before proceeding

questions.explanation: Do not enter the intersection until you verify it is clear of cross traffic and pedestrians.

questions.questionText: If your vehicle begins to skid:

answers.text: Steer in the direction you want the front of the vehicle to go

questions.explanation: Turn the wheel in the direction you want to go (steer into the skid).

questions.questionText: Using a handheld cell phone while driving is allowed for:

answers.text: Making a call (for adults) but NO texting

questions.explanation: Adults may make calls, but texting/emailing is banned. (Note: Junior license holders cannot use it at all? Actually, PA law bans texting for all. Handheld calls are not banned for adults, but strongly discouraged).

questions.questionText: A sign with 'EXIT 25 MPH' indicates:

answers.text: Advisory safe speed for exit ramp

questions.explanation: This is an advisory speed sign recommending a safe speed for the exit ramp.

questions.questionText: Who is responsible for passengers under 18 wearing seat belts?
questions.explanation: The driver is legally responsible for ensuring all passengers under 18 are buckled up.

questions.questionText: A sign with a flagger symbol means:
questions.explanation: This sign warns that a flagger is controlling traffic in a work zone ahead.

questions.questionText: Driving with a suspended license results in:
questions.explanation: Driving while suspended usually results in an additional 1-year suspension and at least a $500 fine.

questions.questionText: When roads are slippery, you should:
questions.explanation: Increase following distance to 5 or 6 seconds on slippery roads.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'No Turn on Red' means:

answers.text: You must wait for a green light to turn
You can turn on red after stopping

questions.explanation: This regulatory sign prohibits turning right on red.

questions.questionText: You may use a shared center turn lane to:
questions.explanation: Center lanes are reserved for making left turns in either direction, not for passing or driving.

questions.questionText: When a school bus is loading students in a loading zone off the roadway (school yard) with no flashing lights:
questions.explanation: If the bus is in a recessed loading zone and lights are NOT flashing, you may pass with caution.

questions.questionText: If an oncoming driver flashes headlights at you, it likely means:

answers.text: Your high beams are on or there is a hazard ahead

questions.explanation: Flashing lights usually indicate you have high beams on or there is danger ahead.

questions.questionText: Is it legal to park on a sidewalk?

answers.text: Yes, if leaving room for pedestrians

questions.explanation: Parking on a sidewalk is illegal at all times.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'Wrong Way' means:

answers.text: You are driving against traffic flow

questions.explanation: This sign warns you are going the wrong direction on a one-way street or ramp.

questions.questionText: You must use your low beams when you are within ___ feet of the vehicle you are following.
questions.explanation: Switch to low beams within 300 feet of the vehicle ahead.

questions.questionText: If you are involved in a crash with a parked vehicle, you must:

answers.text: Leave a note with your info and report it
Drive away if no one saw

questions.explanation: You must locate the owner or leave a note with your name, address, and insurance info, and report it.

questions.questionText: A pentagon sign is used for:
questions.explanation: The pentagon shape is exclusively for School Zones and School Crossings.

questions.questionText: A first DUI offense with BAC .10% to .159% results in:
questions.explanation: High tier DUI (BAC .10-.159) carries a 12-month suspension, jail time, and fines.

questions.questionText: When turning left at an intersection without a specific turn light, you must:
questions.explanation: Left turners must yield to straight-through traffic on green.

questions.questionText: A sign with a 'Soft Shoulder' warning means:

answers.text: Do not drive off the pavement

questions.explanation: The shoulder is soft earth/gravel and may be dangerous if you drive on it.

questions.questionText: You are not allowed to use your high beams within ___ feet of an oncoming vehicle.
questions.explanation: Dim high beams within 500 feet of approaching traffic.

questions.questionText: Alcohol affects a driver by:

answers.text: Slowing reaction time and impairing judgment

questions.explanation: Alcohol slows reflexes, impairs coordination, and reduces judgment.

questions.questionText: Parking is prohibited within ___ feet of a fire hydrant.
questions.explanation: Do not park within 15 feet of a hydrant.

questions.questionText: A sign with a 'Lane Ends' symbol means:
questions.explanation: This sign warns that a lane is ending and traffic must merge.

questions.questionText: You may pass a school bus with flashing red lights ONLY if:

answers.text: You are on the opposite side of a divided highway with a physical barrier
The bus is stopped at a house

questions.explanation: If a physical barrier separates the lanes, oncoming traffic does not need to stop.

questions.questionText: If you are under emotional stress:
questions.explanation: Emotions affect driving; it is best to let someone else drive or wait until you are calm.

questions.questionText: A sign with '35 MPH' under a curve arrow means:

answers.text: Recommended safe speed for curve is 35

questions.explanation: Advisory speed signs show the maximum safe speed for a curve.

questions.questionText: Drivers under 18 cannot have more than ___ non-family passenger(s) for the first 6 months.
questions.explanation: Junior license holders are limited to 1 non-family passenger for the first 6 months.

questions.questionText: Who has the right of way in a traffic circle (roundabout)?
questions.explanation: Entering traffic yields to circulating traffic.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'Center Lane Only' and two-way arrows means:

answers.text: Center lane is for left turns only

questions.explanation: The center lane is shared for left turns from both directions.

questions.questionText: Seat belts prevent:
questions.explanation: Seat belts keep you inside the vehicle and prevent impact with the interior.

questions.questionText: Can you park in front of a public driveway?
questions.explanation: Blocking a private or public driveway is illegal.

questions.questionText: Driving 26-30 mph over the limit results in:
questions.explanation: Speeding 26-30 mph over the limit is a 5-point violation.

questions.questionText: A sign with a 'Do Not Pass' text means:

answers.text: You are in a no passing zone

questions.explanation: This regulatory sign marks the start of a zone where passing is prohibited.

questions.questionText: Are you allowed to back up on an expressway shoulder?
questions.explanation: Backing up on a highway or shoulder is strictly prohibited.

questions.questionText: Before reversing, you should:

answers.text: Check mirrors and look over shoulder

questions.explanation: Check all blind spots by looking over your shoulder before backing.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'Mile Marker 44':
questions.explanation: Mile markers indicate your specific location on the highway for emergencies.

questions.questionText: When can you legally drive around a railroad gate that is down?
questions.explanation: Never drive around gates unless directed by authorized personnel.

questions.questionText: If you approach a traffic light that is not working (black):

answers.text: Main road has right of way

questions.explanation: A malfunctioning signal is treated as a 4-way stop.

questions.questionText: Is it legal to park on a bridge?
questions.explanation: Parking on a bridge or overpass is illegal.

questions.questionText: To enter a gap in highway traffic:

answers.text: Check your blind spot and signal

questions.explanation: Signal early, check blind spots, and merge smoothly.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'Bridge Ices Before Road' means:
questions.explanation: Bridges lack earth insulation and freeze first in cold weather.

questions.questionText: How often must your vehicle be inspected in PA?
questions.explanation: Vehicles must pass a safety inspection every 12 months.

questions.questionText: If you are under 21, you cannot buy, consume, or possess alcohol. This is:
questions.explanation: Zero Tolerance laws prohibit alcohol use by minors.
